optimized.regression

Class LinearRegression

  • java.lang.Object
    • optimized.regression.LinearRegression

  • public class LinearRegression
extends java.lang.Object

    Linear Regression

    Linear Regression implements a sequential and parallel LMS (Least Mean Squared) algorithm to calculate the slope. The intercept can be calculated via sequential LMS, sequential Gradient Descent, or a custom parallel Stochastic Gradient Descent.

    Usage

    Import datasets x values and y values as Double[] : Double[] x,y
    Create a new LinearRegression class : LinearRegression lr = new LinearRegression(x,y)
    Choose a 'fit option' : simpleFit() calculates using sequential LMS for slope and intercept
    simpleFit(false) same as simpleFit()
    simpleFit(true) calculates using parallel LMS for slope, sequential LMS for intercept
    gradientFit(false) calculates using sequential LMS for slope, sequential Gradient Descent for intercept
    gradientFit(true) calculates using parallel LMS for slope, parallel GradientDescent for intercept
    Get slope : getSlope() returns Double
    Get intercept : getIntercept() returns Double
    Get estimated y value at user-specified x value : getEstimatedValue(xValue) returns Double
    Since:
    2019-04-20
    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Neel Drain

      protected void sequentialSlopeEstimator()
      Calculates the slope sequentially using Least Mean Squared (LMS)

      numerator = sum( (x[index] - xMean) * (y[index] - yMean))
      denominator = sum( (x[index] - xMean)^2 )
      slope = numerator / denominator
      private double sequentialSquareResidualSum(double gIntercept)
      Calculates the derivative sum squared residuals sequentially

      private void simpleInterceptEstimator()
      Calculates the intercept sequentially using Least Mean Squared (LMS)

      intercept = yMean - slope * xMean

                        java.lang.Double[] y)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        The main constructor. Takes in a pair of Double arrays. The empty constructor type is not allowed. Checks for: nullity, empty arrays, and that the inputs are of the same length.
        Parameters:
        x - is the input array of independent variables.
        y - is the input array of dependent variables.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

    • Method Detail

      • simpleFit

        public boolean simpleFit()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Calculates slope and intercept using sequential Least Mean Squared (LMS) for both calculations
        Returns:
        true if the calculation succeeded
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • simpleFit

        public boolean simpleFit(boolean parallel)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                         java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Calculates the slope and intercept using either sequential or parallel Least Mean Squared (LMS) based upon the value of the parameter parallel. If parameter parallel is true, then the slope is calculated using parallelSlopeEstimator() else uses sequentialSlopeEstimator(). The interceptis always calculated using simpleInterceptEstimator().
        Parameters:
        parallel - determines whether to use parallel LMS or not
        Returns:
        true if the calculation succeeded
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException

      • gradientFit

        public boolean gradientFit(boolean parallel)
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                           java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Calculates the slope and intercept using either sequential or parallel Least Mean Squared (LMS) coupled with either a sequential or parallel custom Gradient Descent algorithm. If parameter parallel is true, then the slope is calculated using sequentialSlopeEstimator() and the intercept is calculated using sequentialGradientInterceptEstimator(). If the parameter parallel is false, the slope is calculated using parallelSlopeEstimator() and the intercept is calculated using parallelGradientInterceptEstimator().
        Parameters:
        parallel - determines whether to use parallel LMS and Gradient Descent or not
        Returns:
        true if the calculation succeeded
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException

      • parallelSlopeEstimator

        private void parallelSlopeEstimator()
                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                    java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Calculates the slope and intercept using a parallel batch Least Mean Squared (LMS) calculation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException

      • sequentialSlopeEstimator

        protected void sequentialSlopeEstimator()
        Calculates the slope sequentially using Least Mean Squared (LMS)

        numerator = sum( (x[index] - xMean) * (y[index] - yMean))
        denominator = sum( (x[index] - xMean)^2 )
        slope = numerator / denominator

      • parallelGradientInterceptEstimator

        private void parallelGradientInterceptEstimator()
                                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Calculates intercept using a custom version of gradient descent with parallel derivative sum squared residual calcualtions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException

      • parallelSumSquareResidual

        private double parallelSumSquareResidual(java.lang.Double gIntercept)
                                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                         java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Calculates the derivative of sum square residuals in parallel by breaking the data into threadCount sections with dataPerThread data points per section except for the highest numbered thread which contains dataPerThread + remainder data points.
        Parameters:
        gIntercept - is the intercept calculated by parallelGradientInterceptEstimator().
        Returns:
        the derivative of sum squared residuals
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException

      • simpleInterceptEstimator

        private void simpleInterceptEstimator()
        Calculates the intercept sequentially using Least Mean Squared (LMS)

        intercept = yMean - slope * xMean

      • sequentialGradientInterceptEstimator

        private void sequentialGradientInterceptEstimator()
        Calculates the slope using sequential gradient descent with an initial intercept value of INITIAL_INTERCEPT

      • sequentialSquareResidualSum

        private double sequentialSquareResidualSum(double gIntercept)
        Calculates the derivative sum squared residuals sequentially
        Parameters:
        gIntercept - is the intercept chosen by sequentialGradientInterceptEstimator()
        Returns:
        the derivative of the sum of square residuals

        public java.lang.Double getEstimatedValue(java.lang.Double xValue)
        Gets the estimated value of data at xValue using the previously calculated slope and intercept.
        Parameters:
        xValue - is the value to estimate at
        Returns:
        the estimated value (y-value), null if one or neither has been calculated yet.
